intro: Goniothalamus rongklanus, commonly known as the Rongklan nut, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish-brown bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
